isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - ASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING

svcproc.title: SHIFTER HOUSING

note.para: Apply Eaton sealant #71208 or Loctite 242 to the shifter housing plugs which are used to plug oil cooler provision holes. The sealant should be applied so that at least 5 complete threads are covered.

Apply Eaton lockwire #1819 or equivalent to all shifter housing assembly set screws in both blocks and yokes. The wire should anchor the bolt at least 2 complete 360° turns. The lockwire ends should be trimmed and bent out of the way of any part interference.

svcproc.para: Keep yoke bars in neutral while assembling.

step1.para: Assemble the yoke actuator assembly ( Figure 136and Figure 137):

step2.para: Install actuator pin and yoke actuator from the shifter housing bottom.
Install the washer and nut on the shifter housing top. Tighten to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 N·m).

step1.para: Assemble the 1st & reverse shift yoke assembly ( Figure 138):

figure.caption: Figure 138. Assemble 1st and Reverse Shift Yoke Assembly

step2.para: Install plunger in 1st & reverse shift yoke bore, plunger shank to outside.
Install the spring into the bore over the plunger shank.
Install the plug and tighten to compress the spring.
After plug bottoms out, back the plug out 1 to 1-1/2 turns.
Complete the block assembly process by staking the plug through the small hole in block.

step1.para: Lay the assembly on a flat surface with the housing rear to the right ( Figure 139).

figure.caption: Figure 139. Install Bottom Shift Yoke Assemblies

step1.para: Install the bottom shift bar. As the bar passes the bosses, install the two (2) bottom shift yoke assemblies. Finish installation ( Figure 139).
Install the shift yoke lockscrew. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 140).

figure.caption: Figure 140. Place Actuating Plunger in Top Center Bore

step1.para: Place the actuating plunger in the top center bore ( Figure 140).
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the bottom bar ( Figure 141).

figure.caption: Figure 141. Install Interlock Pin in Neutral Notch Bore

step1.para: Hold the middle bar by the notched end and start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 141).
As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing front ( Figure 141).
Just prior to inserting the notched end of bar in the rear boss, install the small interlock pin vertically in the neutral notch bore ( Figure 141).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 142).
Place one 3/4 inch interlock ball in the interlock bore, against the middle bar ( Figure 142).
Hold the top bar by the notched end and start installation. As the bar passes the rear boss, position the shift block ( Figure 142).
As the bar passes the center boss, position the shift yoke on the bar, long hub to the housing rear ( Figure 142).
Install the shift block and shift yoke lockscrews. Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m). Lockwire securely ( Figure 143).
If equipped, install the oil trough. Tighten the retaining bolts to 8 to 12 ft-lbs. (11 to 16 N·m) ( Figure 143).
Install the three (3) tension balls, one in each housing top bore. Install the three (3) detent springs, one over each tension ball ( Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Install Tension Balls and Detent Springs
